article.title: Atlantic_%28disambiguation%29
article.paragraph: TheAtlantic Oceanis the second largest of the world's oceans.
article.heading: Places

list.listitem: Atlantic, North Carolina, an unincorporated community in eastern Carteret County
Atlantic, Seattle, a neighborhood in Washington state

article.heading: In transportation

list.listitem: TheAtlantic 85 class lifeboatsserve the shores of the United Kingdom and Ireland as a part of the RNLI inshore fleet.
Austin Atlantic, a British car produced by the Austin Motor Company from 1949 to 1952
Atlantic (1783 ship)''Atlantic'' (1783), 18th century merchant ship
Atlantic (1921 automobile), an obsolete automobile company
Fisker Atlantic, a plug-in electric car
Atlantic (train)''Atlantic'' (train), a named passenger train operated by Canadian Pacific Railway and later Via Rail
Atlantic (locomotive)''Atlantic'' (locomotive), name of an early steam-powered locomotive of the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad with a 0-4-0 wheel arrangement
Atlantic, a type of steam locomotive with a4-4-2 (locomotive)4-4-2 wheel arrangement(UIC classification 2B1),
RMS Atlantic, a steamship that sank off Halifax, Nova Scotia in 1873
Atlantic (yacht)''Atlantic'' (yacht), a three-masted gaff-rigged schooner
Atlantic Airways, a Faroese airline company
Air Atlantic, a Canadian airline
